Ad Text:
Training Program Design & Delivery

Support the design, refinement, and rollout of AI-focused training and adoption programs across the organisation.
Enable training content through enterprise learning systems and other delivery channels.
Develop and facilitate training modules, workshops, and demonstrations covering:
AI fluency and foundational concepts
AI productivity tools (e.g., MS Copilot, GitHub Copilot, industry specific AI platforms)
Practical AI techniques such as prompting and model selection
Ethical, responsible, and secure use of AI
Coordinate internal showcases, seminars, and awareness campaigns to build confidence and enthusiasm around AI adoption.


Knowledge Management

Create and maintain a centralised repository of AI-related learning materials.
Produce clear, accessible communications that simplify AI concepts, including FAQs, guides, and quick reference resources to support ongoing learning.


Stakeholder Management & Collaboration

Serve as a trusted advisor to business units on how to best leverage enterprise AI tools and emerging technologies.
Work closely with stakeholders to ensure training initiatives align with organisational policies, procedures, and strategic priorities.
Act as a primary point of contact for AI enablement across the organisation


Enabling L&D Insights to Inform AI Strategy

Provide learning focused insights that help shape ongoing AI strategy, informed by adoption outcomes and learner engagement across the organisation.
Collect feedback from participants and stakeholders to refine and enhance training programs.
Stay across emerging AI trends and integrate relevant developments into training content.
Track and report on AI adoption metrics and engagement patterns.
Contribute to experimentation, measurement, and evidence building around AI enablement initiatives.

Job Title: Senior Systems Engineer - R&D | Medical Devices | Mount Waverley | PRD/ALM
Ad Text:
Enjoy a dynamic role where every day is different.

Access global career pathways across Danaher's world-class brands.

Work in a fast-paced global organisation dedicated to advancing cancer diagnostics and improving patient outcomes.

Join a large, supportive, cross-functional R&D team that values collaboration and continuous learning.

Gain end-to-end exposure to the full product design lifecycle—from concept development through testing and transfer to manufacturing.

Perfect for detail-oriented engineers who thrive in technical documentation, design change processes, and structured engineering environments.

Work-life balance with a 9–5 schedule and flexible start and finish times.




Next Steps: Please complete your formal application using the link below:

https://danaher.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/DanaherJobs/job/Mount-Waverley-Victoria-Australia/Senior-Systems-Engineer---R-D---Medical-Devices---Mount-Waverley---PRD-ALM---New-Product-Release-Experience-required_R1303105


Job Description

Bring more to life.

Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?

At Leica Biosystems, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact. 

You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.

At Leica Biosystems, we’re not just shaping the future of cancer diagnostics — we’re transforming lives. Our mission of “Advancing Cancer Diagnostics, Improving Lives” is the driving force behind everything we do. As a global leader with the most comprehensive portfolio spanning from biopsy to diagnosis, we empower clinicians with innovative, reliable solutions so they can give patients timely, accurate answers when they need them most. When you join Leica Biosystems, you’re not just taking a job; you’re becoming part of a passionate team that knows every moment matters when it comes to cancer. You’ll help develop diagnostic solutions that turn anxiety into answers, and aid the acceleration of next-generation, life-changing therapies. Surrounded by a diverse and collaborative global community, you’ll be inspired each day to stretch, grow, and make an impact.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

The Senior Systems Engineer is responsible for providing systems engineering expertise to a cross-functional hardware engineering team that are working on a multitude of development projects.

Location: This position reports to the Hardware Engineering Manager and is part of the R&D department located in Mount Waverley, Melbourne and will be an on-site full-time role.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Lead the development and implementation of hardware system strategies throughout an R&D cross-functional team, providing thorough technical guidance aligned with product requirements, project objectives, and functional workflows .

Lead system verification and validation strategies and activities for Train releases, including developing test protocols and executing integration, verification, and validation testing.

Deliver robust and high-quality engineering solutions that are compliant with all applicable business and regulatory requirements.

Perform trade-off analysis to assess various design options, considering factors such as performance, cost, risk, and user experience.

Drive engineering changes through to full release across complex systems, following Leica Biosystems' QMS, while leading on Systems related tasks.

The essential requirements of the job include:

Minimum 3 years of experience in the Research & Development department within highly regulated industries (medical devices, defense, aerospace, pharmaceutical), with experience releasing new products to market,

Degree qualified Engineer with minimum 8 years’ relevant experience in developing and delivering complex electro-mechanical devices using a variety of manufacturing methods and working with suppliers.

Experience with PRD (product requirements documentation systems), and ALM (Application Lifecycle Management) .

Self-driven and proactive, with the ability to communicate effectively across diverse stakeholder groups, including electronic engineers, production teams, and operators.

Excellent technical communication skills, able to convey complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Strategic mindset, with a strong interest in planning, forecasting, and aligning work with broader business objectives.

Travel, Motor Vehicle Record & Physical/Environment Requirements: if applicable for role

Ability to travel - less than 10% of role.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:

Designing, conducting and documenting verification and validation of designs.

Project management experience.

ISO 13485 and FDE QSR 820

IEC 61010

Up to date Victorian state engineering registration in Mechanical and/or Electrical Engineering or eligibility to get registered (with proof of streamlined eligibility, such as Washington Accor listed degree). Note: It is the responsibility of the Engineer to keep their registration status current to provide professional engineering services in Victoria, with the level of responsibilities set out in this position description.

Leica Biosystems, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at Danaher Benefits Info.

If you’re an Automation Engineer who enjoys new challenges, wants real ownership over end-to-end solutions including seeing it come to life, and values working with other capable, straight-talking engineers — this role is likely for you.

At Intelligent Robotics, we design and deliver novel industrial automation and robotic systems that change how entire processes operate. Much of what we work on doesn’t come with a playbook — and that’s exactly why our engineers are here.

About the role

As an Automation & Robotics Engineer, you’ll play a key role in designing, programming and commissioning complex mechatronic systems across a range of industries.  You’ll work closely with a small, highly capable team to:

●      Concept and develop automation and robotics solutions, often in applications that have never been automated before

●      Translate concepts into electrical design, PLC programming (structured text), and robotic programming

●      Integrate controls, robotics, mechanical systems and software into cohesive solutions

●      Commission systems on-site and bring designs into reality

●      Stay at the forefront of automation technology and apply new approaches where they add real value

You’ll also gain exposure to areas such as PC programming (C++), machine vision and AI, depending on project needs and your skillset.

We think our values tell you a lot about us and how we work:

●      Teamwork – we think ‘Team’ for us and our customers, we help and support each other, and we keep each other safe

●      Enjoyment – we’re driven and genuinely enjoy what we do, and build a confident ‘can-do’ positive atmosphere.

●      Openness – no BS, no blame.  We focus on attacking problems, not people.

●      Creativity and courage – we like to push boundaries, act nimbly, and question things

●      Results – we set lofty goals, and take great pride when we hit them

What makes you a great fit

You don’t need to tick every box, but you likely bring:

●      Experience delivering automation projects with PLC programming (comfortable in structured text) and robotic systems

●      End-to-end project experience — from concept and design through to on-site commissioning

●      A genuine interest in R&D-style problem solving and learning new technologies

●      Confidence working closely with others and challenging ideas constructively

●      Comfort working across different industries and technical environments

Growth here isn’t generic training — it’s learning through real problems, so expect exposure to new industries, technologies and system architectures. You will be supported to develop skills that improve outcomes (technical or otherwise).

Some considerations which might not make this the role for you:

●      The work can be intense, especially when commissioning complex systems

●      Projects involve site work, sometimes for extended periods

●      We work on problems that can be frustrating before they’re rewarding

●      You’ll work across industries including manufacturing, meat processing and mining

●      On-site travel required during commissioning and support phases, with hybrid working arrangements (mix of home and office) in other project phases.

About us

Intelligent Robotics Pty Ltd is a leading provider of industrial automation and robotic solutions across food manufacturing, mining and infrastructure. We are dedicated to helping our clients achieve greater productivity, efficiency and sustainability. We’re known for solving complex problems with practical, innovative engineering — and for how we treat our people.

Apply now to join a team that values capability, honesty and building things that matter.

About Peoplebank:
Peoplebank, part of RGF Staffing ANZ, is a leading talent solutions provider. We place the brightest IT & digital professionals into some of the region’s top employers. We are expert recruiters who have been placing IT & digital specialists with some of the most dynamic and recognised organisations in the Asia Pacific region for over 34 years.
 
About the Role:
Our Federal Government Client is seeking a Senior AI Engineer.
 
This is a contract role until 30 June 2026 with a 12-month extension option available if required, located at our client’s Canberra office.
 
As the selected candidate, you will:

Lead the design, engineering and deployment of data science and AI solutions in collaboration with data professionals, digital professionals and end-users.
Architect, build and manage cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS or Google Cloud) using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and ensuring appropriate security controls and scalability.
Drive strategic projects involving data ingestion and curation, exploratory data analysis, natural language processing, use of generative AI (including agent-based generative AI), predictive and prescriptive modelling, deployment of self-service solutions and ad-hoc data science products.
Prototype and develop engineering solutions at short notice for high priority data science and AI projects.
Coordinate and collaborate with other teams and staff to build internal capability and establish/adopt standards and procedures across the development product life cycle.
Use customer-centred approaches to design and prototype new technologies, tools, and methods.
Work with IT service providers to specify requirements and support the establishment and upgrade of on-premises and cloud infrastructure/tools.
Work closely with business users and IT service providers to select suitable technologies to deliver, manage and improve data science and AI solutions.
 
To be successful in this role you should have:

Experience leading data, AI and cloud engineering work within the public service or a complex, multi-stakeholder environment.
Experience establishing and maintaining rapport with clients (business areas) and suppliers (IT areas), including where there are no pre-existing relationships.
Experience designing, implementing and managing relational databases such as Teradata, BigQuery and others.
Experience designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines, monitoring systems, containerisation, orchestration and automation.
Experience with Agile or other iterative solution delivery practices, including DevOps.
Experience designing and managing cloud infrastructure in Azure, AWS or Google Cloud.
Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research to address knowledge gaps and adopt emerging technologies to generate innovative solutions.
Well-developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to translate and present technical solutions in a range of engaging formats to non-technical audiences.

Due to security clearance requirements for this role, candidates must be Australian citizens holding a baseline level security clearance or higher.
 
 Benefits of being a Peoplebank contractor:

Personalised Attention: You’ll be assigned a dedicated Account Manager to support your unique needs.
User-Friendly Services and Ongoing Support: Easy online timesheet lodgement, plus full access to contractor care, payroll, and admin support throughout your contract.
Choice and Flexibility: A wide variety of contracting options tailored to your preferences and circumstances.
Industry-Leading Payroll Services: Enjoy the reliability of accurate, on-time weekly payments.
Contractor Satisfaction Focus: Our goal is to be your top choice for IT contracting and permanent roles—with your success at the centre of everything we do.
 
Apply now for immediate consideration – contact Ron on 02 6245 1706 or Ron.Luu@peoplebank.com.au quoting Job Reference: #269689.
 
Please note: Only candidates that meet the above criteria will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in the position.
 


Peoplebank and Leaders IT are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone belongs. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need adjustments to the recruitment process due to your circumstances, please let us know—we’re here to support you.

Job Title: AI Engineers x 2 - Perth CBD - 12 month contracts
Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Job Summary / Overview
This role supports the design and delivery of an enterprise AI platform enabling ML, LLM and GenAI solutions. It works closely with technical teams to develop scalable, secure and reliable AI capabilities that deliver business value. The position contributes to platform engineering, solution integration and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain reusable AI components, APIs and microservices
Support ML and GenAI architecture delivery including retrieval pipelines and agent workflows
Build capabilities for deployment, monitoring, evaluation and lifecycle management
Integrate AI services into enterprise environments aligned with standards
Collaborate with cross functional teams to deliver production grade AI solutions
Support experimentation and prototyping activities
Document patterns, best practices and procedures
Contribute to continuous improvement and knowledge sharing

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI or related discipline
2+ years' experience delivering AI or ML systems
Strong background in LLM
Proficiency in Python
Experience with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face or LangChain
Exposure to embedding models, vector stores or retrieval approaches
Cloud experience with AWS or Azure
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform and CI/CD
Familiarity with data and platform engineering technologies including Snowflake, Kafka, S3, REST APIs or microservices
Experience with Git and Agile workflows

Skills & Competencies

Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Effective communication and documentation abilities
Stakeholder engagement and collaboration skills

Working Conditions (Optional)
Located in Perth CBD.

Compensation & Benefits (Optional)

Apply Now
"Match the selection criteria? Click the "APPLY" button now!
Alternatively, for a confidential conversation, contact Alice Tan on +61 8 6212 5598

Australian Naval Infrastructure Pty Ltd (ANI) is the owner, developer and manager of the Osborne Naval Shipyards, supporting the Commonwealth’s Naval Shipbuilding Plan. ANI is responsible for designing, constructing and managing the shipyard infrastructure, including the new Nuclear-Powered Submarine Construction Yard to support the AUKUS program, and operating and maintaining common use facilities.  

ANI has an opportunity for an experienced individual who will join our Project Delivery team in Adelaide. In this role you will be instrumental by professionally managing ANI’s suite of customer and internally generated infrastructure requirements. This role will be instrumental in the longevity of the project, through reviews and change management as the program matures and requirements evolve.

Your key responsibilities will include:  

Implement the ANI Requirements Management Framework

Deliver and monitor execution of the requirements management activities

Liaise with internal stakeholders, external stakeholders and executives in all matters pertaining to requirements and verification

Maintain and evolve the DOORS NG schema to support requirement lifecycle stages. As well as administer the DOORS NG environment

Ensure customer requirements are correctly imported into DOORS NG, structured according to project schemas, and aligned with work instructions and traceability strategies

Strike baselines at completion gates and other reviews as necessary, manage requirement maturity, and apply configuration control to track changes and ensure alignment with the Configuration Management Plan

Collaborate with consultants to derive requirements from source inputs, ensuring they follow style guides and are traceable. 

Mentor project delivery teams in requirements good practice.

Provide input and participate in area project meetings and other/ future forums as required. 

Work closely with the Program Directors to ensure that requirements act as an enabler for effective control of the design program

About You:

You will be able to demonstrate strong organisation skills, efficiency when managing competing demands and solid time management abilities. You will be an approachable and collaborative team player who displays a high degree of professionalism. You will have strong attention to detail, sound organisational, written and verbal communication skills.

Strong experience in presentations and briefings will be an asset, as well as the ability to articulate complex concepts and critical issues with language understandable to differing members of the company.

You will also have:

Proficiency in industry standard requirements management toolset(s). Experience specifically with IBM DOORS NG would be an advantage.

Degree level qualification in a relevant discipline from a recognised tertiary institute or significant industry experience (e.g. Engineering)

Experience in requirements management in a defence or infrastructure environment.

Experience and comfort in dealing with all levels of an organisation and stakeholder groups, including public and local interest group

Eligibility: 

Applicants must be Australian citizens and either hold or be able to gain and maintain a Defence security clearance. Applicants will be required to consent to background checks.  

Application Information: 

To apply, click the ‘Apply’ button and follow the prompts, include a cover letter & current resume. 

Applications close: 5pm, 4 March 2026

Job Title: Chief Technology Officer - Industrial Tech & ML
Ad Text:
Asset-intensive industrial technology product environment 
Own the convergence of machine learning, hardware and software  
Lead the next level of leadership and execution 
Relocation assistance available for Australian applicants
About the Opportunity 
You will join a product-led technology business whose solutions are deployed in asset-intensive, operationally complex environments, supporting enterprise customers operating large-scale, long-life physical assets where reliability, precision and safety-critical performance matter. Deep technical foundations are already in place. The next chapter is about cohesion, execution and translating advanced capability into consistent, real-world commercial outcomes. 

As the CTO, you will become the single point of accountability across machine learning, software and hardware. Machine learning sits at the core of the product and is central to how value is created, scaled and delivered. Your mandate is to bring clarity where there is complexity, alignment where there has been fragmentation, and momentum where ambition is high.  

You will operate as a peer at the leadership table, guiding strategic decisions, shaping delivery and manufacturing models, and representing technology with authority in senior customer discussions. This role is for a leader who thrives in ambiguity, sets direction, and brings people with them through change. 
About you 
You are a proven technology leader with experience guiding complex engineering teams through periods of transition and growth. You MUST have led machine learning capability as a core part of a product or platform and understand how to orchestrate specialist ML, software and hardware teams. Your background must come from a product-led technology businesses, whether early-stage or established at scale, delivering solutions into complex, asset-heavy operating environments where software, data and physical systems converge.
You bring strong commercial judgement and are confident operating in client-facing environments, representing technology credibly with senior stakeholders. You operate comfortably at executive level, balancing ambition with disciplined decision-making. You lead with clarity and empathy, earning trust through sound judgement and technical credibility. 

What’s on Offer 
This is an opportunity to take ownership of technology at a pivotal stage and leave a lasting mark on the organisation. You will have genuine authority to shape strategy, define how technology is delivered, and build an engineering function that is aligned, motivated and execution-focused. Leadership is not symbolic here; it is expected, supported and visible. 

You will work side by side with founders and senior leaders, influencing decisions that matter and guiding the transition from deep technical capability into broader commercial impact. The outcomes of your leadership will be seen in real-world, operationally critical environments where performance and reliability truly count. 
 
For further information please apply via the role advert or contact Sarah Layer or Tiffany Cording with any specific questions: tiffanyc@areteexecutive.com.au or 0450 277 192. Please note I am based in Brisbane. Given the high volume of applications and enquiries, we kindly ask for your patience as we work through responses. Please note that email applications will not be accepted to ensure a fair and consistent process. 
  
You must have unrestricted working rights in Australia to apply. As part of the recruitment process, reference checks will be conducted, with two recent references from direct line managers being mandatory. In addition, employers may require other pre-employment checks at their discretion, which can include medical, police, or psychometric assessments depending on the specific requirements of the role. 
  
Arete Executive specialises in the Search & Recruitment of Leadership & Executive roles throughout Australia. We offer cost effective headhunting services from 10% with guaranteed results delivered in under 20 days. Candidate confidentiality is assured with all applications, with your privacy being our utmost priority. Partner with us for fast, reliable, and impactful recruitment solutions.

We are seeking an experienced Systems and Virtualisation Engineer to support and improve enterprise infrastructure platforms across on-prem and cloud environments. This is a hands-on role focused on stability, optimisation, and project delivery within a structured IT environment.
 
Key Responsibilities

Maintain and support physical, virtualised, and cloud platforms
Support software-defined networking and security environments
Manage enterprise storage and backup systems
Handle BAU support, incidents, and service requests
Deliver infrastructure projects and platform upgrades
Drive automation and continuous improvement
Engage with vendors and service partners
Maintain technical documentation
Participate in on-call support when required
 
Skills and Experience

Strong Windows Server administration experience
Enterprise virtualisation design and support background
Experience with SDN and datacentre networking security
Storage, backup, and disaster recovery experience
Public and private cloud exposure
SQL Server high availability experience
Infrastructure automation and migration exposure
 
Requirements

5+ years hands-on enterprise infrastructure experience
3+ years of hands-on experience virtualized environment and backup technologies.
3+ years of hands-on experience with Datacentres integrated VMware NSX networking environment
2+ years supporting SQL Server HA environments
Strong documentation and communication skills
Understanding of ITIL, security standards, and lifecycle management
 
Certifications Preferred

Azure fundamentals
VMware Certified
Microsoft Associate
 
Additional information:

$130,000 (+ super)
5 days in the office – Melbourne or Sydney CBD
People focused culture – Monthly get togethers/rewards & incentives

If you live in Australia or New Zealand, you’ve likely heard of AMP. But at a time when society is changing, we are too. We’re now a nimbler business with new leadership and thinking. 

For us, these are exciting times. There’s a real potential for big thinkers to help us redefine what financial services could be and turn our legacy into something even more positive and powerful for the future.

Help people create their tomorrow, while you create yours

We help people with their banking, super, retirement and finances. Through upturns, downturns, recessions, and major life transitions. Every day, we help people see and make more of their financial potential, so that they can create their tomorrow. And we’ve been doing it for over 170 years. 

If we do our job well, we genuinely add to the prosperity of our country and its people.

As a Senior Data Scientist within AMP Bank’s Data, Analytics & Insights team, you will help transform the Bank into a data‑driven organisation. You will lead advanced modelling, improve data accessibility and support strategic decision‑making across credit risk, operations, finance and customer domains

How will you make an impact

Make data available and accessible for the business.
Build and maintain predictive and stress‑testing models.
Partner with Data Platforms and Bank IT on data ingestion and consumption.
Drive automation of applications and data processes.
Deliver analytics and business insights through modelling and visualisation.
Support data flow and infrastructure for existing Stress Testing models.
Contribute to deployment activities across Credit Risk Analytics.
Build industry‑standard solutions using AWS.
Collaborate with external providers including credit bureaus, property data providers and decision systems vendors.

What you will bring to the role 

Ideally at least 3–5 years’ experience with R and SQL (with additional languages desirable), strong reporting and visualisation capability with RStudio Shiny and exceptional proficiency in creating and implementing plumber APIs. 
Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Data Engineering, Information Management, Mathematics or Physics, with hands‑on experience using RStudio, Jira and Confluence. 
Background in financial services, ideally Credit Risk, Finance or Operations, combined with practical experience working in AWS environments. 
Prior experience managing a small team and the ability to influence senior stakeholders without direct authority. 
Commercially astute with a strong strategic focus and proven experience delivering against project timelines.

What we look for in you

You are a curious, collaborative problem‑solver who can translate complex data into meaningful insights. You thrive in ambiguity and can balance strategic thinking with hands‑on delivery. You build collaborative relationships, communicate clearly with technical and non‑technical stakeholders and enjoy contributing to a culture of learning, innovation and continuous improvement. You also bring an entrepreneurial mindset and a strong interest in shaping AMP’s digital bank of the future.

Your exposure to AI/ML and experience building AI/ML use-case frameworks will be well regarded

You’ll thrive here if…

If you can adapt from BAU to the ambiguous with ease, you’ll do well here. Change is never easy, so bring your commitment, grit and growth mindset.

Because we run lean, you’ll be expected to jump in and deliver across a variety of areas. Meaning, you’ll be closer to the action and executive decisions that influence where we go next.

If you’re someone that can hold their own, you’ll find AMP quite liberating.

Why we think you’ll love working at AMP

Doing what we’ve always done is not an option, so your clever ideas will get airtime here. You’ll be encouraged to speak up and try new things. If they don’t work, we move on – better for it.

We know there’s no one way of doing things. So, you won’t have to sacrifice who you are or how you work to fit in here. We’re inclusive and flexible in many of the ways you’d expect. And in some of the ways you wouldn’t. As long as your health and wellbeing come first - at home and at work. 

In fact, most of what makes AMP such a welcoming, enjoyable place to work are our people. Wherever you go, you’ll find moments to connect, feel valued and do meaningful work. 

Whether it’s through our first-class leaders who are invested in you and your success. Through year-round opportunities to volunteer, fundraise and give back to the community. Or in the everyday challenges you face as we work together to strengthen this great organisation. Challenges that will stretch you, amplify your potential and compound the impact you have. 

We believe in the power of inclusion and diversity

We’re dedicated to fostering inclusion, diversity, and a warm feeling of belonging at AMP. It sparks creativity, ignites innovation, and turns up the dial on the quality of our decisions and performance. This not only makes our workplace more engaged but also leads to better connections with our customers. 

We're your allies in the search for the perfect fit - when you apply, let us know how we can support you to put your best self forward during our selection process. 

We're also committed to enhancing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, so we enthusiastically encourage candidates from these backgrounds to apply and explore our Reconciliation Action Plan on our website.

Ready to create your tomorrow?

If you’re someone who sees opportunity where others see challenge, come and work with us in smart, progressive ways as we transform an iconic Australian brand for the future. And, through a series of career-defining moments, create your own tomorrow.

Don’t procrastinate! We review applications when we get them, and if we discover the ideal candidate, we may close the role earlier than the advertised close date.

Looking forward to meeting you

The opportunity

At Smartmoney Wealth Management, we’re building technology to make money clear, visible, and actionable in a world where finances are increasingly digital and fragmented.

Alongside our core advice business, we have already commenced building a new AI-driven financial intelligence platform. The next phase is execution — getting it live, reliable, and delivering real outcomes.

We’re looking for an experienced AI Solutions Engineer to help finish, deploy, and scale this platform, while also applying AI to improve internal processes across the Smartmoney business.

The role

This is a hands-on execution role.

You will:

Take an already-started AI platform and get it live and working correctly

Build, refine, and deploy AI systems using real financial and property data

Implement LLM- and agent-based systems where they create measurable efficiency

Improve internal workflows at Smartmoney using AI (analysis, automation, decision support)

Work directly with the founders and senior team

Own delivery, not just design

This is not a research or advisory role. It is about deploying and improving real systems.

Who this is for

You are an experienced AI engineer who:

Has deployed AI systems into production

Is comfortable working end-to-end with imperfect data

Enjoys taking something part-built and making it work properly

Can balance speed, quality, and reliability

Wants their work used daily, not parked in a roadmap

Fintech or regulated-environment experience is useful, not mandatory.

Location & compensation

Hybrid (Australia-based)

Competitive salary

Equity available for the right candidate

Why this role matters

You’ll help bring a new AI platform from build to live

You’ll directly improve how a real wealth management business operates

You’ll work closely with decision-makers, not through layers

Strong pathway to expanded technical leadership as the platform scales

How to apply

Send:

A short summary of AI systems you’ve deployed

Your role in getting them live

Why this opportunity is interesting to you

Category:
Architects (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Reporting to the Program Director, this role is responsible for developing solution designs which are fit for purpose and encompass all appropriate design specifications to support successful solution build, implementation and operation.

Your key responsibilities will include:

Design fit for purpose solutions that fully encompass the architectural concerns of business, information, application, technology and security domains in alignment with Enterprise Architecture strategies, directives and standards.
Work with Vendors to identify solution capabilities and assure strategic alignment.
Ensure system requirements are sufficiently captured to drive the architecting of a solution that fully meets the needs and expectations of system stakeholders.
Develop documentation including Digital Blueprints, Solution Architecture Documents, Solution Implementation Designs.
Consult, negotiate and communicate with system stakeholders and ICT professionals to promote shared and consistent understanding and acceptance of the proposed solution.
Provide expert advice and communicate solution alternatives, architectural risks, issues and resulting implications.
Contribute in the development of strategic project plans and schedules, including the identification of project risks, issues and appropriate mitigation strategies. 

Is this opportunity for you?

To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate expertise in leading the development of solutions architectures for complex systems as well as your proven ability to evaluate and undertake impact analysis on major architectural solutions and assess associated risks and issues. You will also have proven experience in promoting and ensuring the effective use of solution architecture techniques, methodologies and tools.
Crucially, you will bring a positive and proactive approach to work and be able to work collaboratively within a high performing team. Building effective relationships with key senior stakeholders and decision makers is crucial to your success in this role. You will have exceptional ability to translate this into a comprehensive and efficient business solution and communicate this with stakeholders at all levels and of varying technical ability. You will be confident in consulting, negotiating with and providing high level advice around solution architecture principles, practices and processes to influence decisions on large scale project delivery.
An understanding of clinical systems, including ieMR, pharmacy and or radiology will be highly regarded, with the ability to lead technical discussions and solutions.
You must have sound knowledge of at least one of the following:
- Enterprise Applications including Integrations at scale.|
- Clinical systems and or infrastructure.
- Significant server and storage environments including networks.
- Data – Data warehousing, migrations and management.
- Integrated Electronic Medical Record.

Application authentication solutions and experience with legacy applications will be highly regarded.To apply for this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume along with a brief statement (maximum 2 pages) addressing the "How you will be assessed" criteria outlined in the role description. In your statement, please also highlight your experience with the relevant technologies and applications listed above, providing specific examples of your expertise in any of the key areas.

Benefits of working with eHealth Queensland:

By joining eHealth Queensland, you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success. 

You will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:

Competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading
Flexible working arrangements
Diverse work culture
Career training and development

To apply for this exciting opportunity, submit your resume and a short statement (maximum 2 pages) online today.

Should you require additional support or reasonable adjustments during our recruitment process to ensure you can demonstrate your ability to meet the inherent requirements of the role, please contact Talent Acquisition Services via email eQH-DSB-TalentAcquisition@health.qld.gov.au

We’re working with a fast-growing Australian tech company that’s building real, production AI. They’re looking for a Senior AI Engineer to own how LLMs are integrated into customer-facing products. This is a hands-on role for someone who knows how to take AI from idea to production and keep it running properly.

You’ll sit right at the intersection of AI, software engineering, and ML Ops. The LLMs already exist. Your job is to integrate them intelligently, orchestrate workflows, scale them reliably, and make sure they actually deliver value to users.

What you’ll be doing
Building and shipping LLM-powered features used directly by customers
Using Google ADK and modern AI tooling to create agents, workflows, and automation
Owning ML Ops end to end including deployment, monitoring, evaluation, and lifecycle management
Working closely with engineers, product, and stakeholders to turn real business problems into AI solutions
Designing scalable, secure AI systems running in Azure (GCP or AWS experience is also fine)
Influencing architecture and setting best practice for how AI is delivered across the platform
What they’re looking for
Strong background in AI and Machine Learning with real software engineering depth
Proven experience integrating LLMs via APIs and platforms not training your own models
Hands-on ML Ops experience in production not theory
Experience building and supporting customer-facing AI products
Cloud experience with Azure (GCP or AWS also fine)
Someone autonomous, pragmatic, and comfortable talking to both engineers and non-technical stakeholders
This is a role for someone who wants ownership, impact, and the chance to shape how AI is actually used in a growing product, not sit on the sidelines.

If you would like to hear more about this role, please feel free to reach out!
nat@justdigitalpeople.com.au

Company: Cognizant Technology Solutions Australia Pty Ltd
Ad Text:
As a Test Automation Architect, you will make an impact by designing and evolving enterprise-grade automation frameworks that enable innovation and scalability. You will be a valued member of the Quality Engineering & Assurance team and work collaboratively with senior engineers, consultants, and business stakeholders to align automation and AI strategies with organizational goals.

In this role, you will:

·        Lead and enhance the Enterprise Playwright Framework (UI & API) for modularity and maintainability

·        Architect CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and Bitbucket, including secure secrets management via KeyVault

·        Drive AI innovation through Copilot and agentic models for autonomous test generation and self-healing scripts

·        Modernize and uplift legacy frameworks to align with strategic automation practices

·        Mentor senior automation engineers and consultants to build technical capability

·        Monitor industry trends and adopt advancements to improve efficiency and customer value

Work model:

We believe hybrid work is the way forward as we strive to provide flexibility wherever possible. Based on this role’s business requirements, this is a hybrid position requiring 2–3 days a week in a client or Cognizant office in Sydney, NSW. Regardless of your working arrangement, we are here to support a healthy work-life balance through our various wellbeing programs.

The working arrangements for this role are accurate as of the date of posting. This may change based on the project you’re engaged in, as well as business and client requirements. Rest assured; we will always be clear about role expectations.

What you need to have to be considered

·        Extensive experience in test automation (7+ years)

·        Strong expertise in AI/ML testing applications and enterprise-scale AI adoption

·        Hands-on experience with Playwright, Selenium, UFT Developer, and mainframe testing tools

·        Strong coding skills in TypeScript/JavaScript, Java, and Python

·        Experience with CI/CD and DevOps integration

·        Excellent communication and leadership skills

These will help you stand out

·        Experience with agent workflows and LLM integration

·        Knowledge of AI model lifecycles and ML platforms

·        Familiarity with automation frameworks and cloud-based testing environments

·        Ability to mentor and lead technical teams effectively

Job Title: AI Automation Tester & AI Support Engineer
Ad Text:
About the Role

Location: Eveleigh/WFH
Contract: Until 30/06/2026
Pay rate: $850 - $1000 Per day + Super

We are seeking an AI Support Engineer to join our AI team in a hands-on support-focused role as well as a Senior AI Performance Tester.

Key Responsibilities (AI Support Engineer)
Manage and triage the Level 1 support queue via ServiceNow
Respond to school users raising tickets or calling for support
Communicate directly with users — including phone calls when required (schools do not use Teams)
Perform initial troubleshooting across backend systems (Python, Node.js)
Support AI-based services including AI Search and monitoring tools
Review logs and diagnostics using tools such as Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and Log Analytics
Escalate issues appropriately with clear documentation and findings
Key Responsibilities (Senior AI Performance Tester)
Design, develop, and maintain automation test frameworks
Execute performance, load, and stress testing for AI services
Work with existing test assets, scripts, and pre-built logs
Analyse test results and identify performance bottlenecks
Collaborate closely with developers and AI engineers
Produce high-quality technical documentation and test reports
Ensure test coverage aligns with system architecture and performance expectations
Required Skills & Experience
Experience in technical support or QA support roles
Strong communication skills and confidence speaking directly with users
Extensive experience in automation and performance testing
Strong technical background (pure technical testing — non-functional)
Experience testing backend systems and APIs

We are oOh!media (pronounced “oh!” media). 

oOh!media is the #1 Out of Home company in Australia and New Zealand.  

We exist to make public spaces better and brands unmissable, proudly leading the market with innovation, creativity, data and results. Our network plays an important role in the communities they are located, creating engaging environments that inform, entertain and inspire, while connecting brands with audiences at scale.  

We are oOh!media, and we are unmissable.

Join us:  

We’re a team driven by creativity, innovation, and a sense of community. We show up every day ready to be bold, brave, and push the boundaries of Out of Home advertising. You’ll work alongside a group of talented individuals across Australia and New Zealand, all of whom are dedicated to raising the bar. If you’re ready to realize your potential and make an impact, join us. 

About the opportunity:

 Permanent role
Based in North Sydney

We are seeking a hands-on AI Solutions Engineer to join our Engineering team and act as the technical builder responsible for turning AI hypotheses into secure, scalable prototypes and automations.

This role is the bridge across data, platform, and product domains, connecting systems, data, and intelligence. You will blend rapid experimentation with disciplined engineering, ensuring AI prototypes are built safely, run reliably, and can evolve into long-term industrial capabilities.

If you are a problem-solver and tinkerer who thrives on figuring out how to connect systems and automate workflows, this is your chance to make a massive impact.

Key responsibilities and experience:

Building Tactical AI Solutions: Translate user stories into working AI workflows, automations, and copilots. You will build and connect data pipelines, APIs, and low-code components across systems.
Prototyping & Experimentation: Safely experiment with emerging frameworks, including LLMs, Agentic systems, and RAG architectures.
Security & Governance: Apply responsible AI principles and ensure solutions comply with InfoSec and privacy standards.
Data Connectivity: Ensure secure and efficient data access (read, transform, integrate) across all solutions.

You will also have:

3–6 years in Data, Platform, or Automation Engineering.
Skilled in SQL, APIs, and low-code/no-code platforms (e.g., Power Automate, Logic Apps, Zapier).
Familiarity with Python/JavaScript for glue code and LLM integration.
Experience integrating SaaS tools (e.g., CRM, CMS, BI, Data Warehousing).
Experience with AWS, Azure, M365, and data governance standards.
Familiarity with RAG, Agentic systems, and MCP frameworks.
Detail-oriented, secure by design, and disciplined with data.
A fast learner who stays current with emerging AI tools and frameworks.
A natural collaborator comfortable partnering with non-technical peers.

Bonus: Experience with DataBricks is an advantage.




Our benefits and perks:

Competitive salary package 
A positive, supportive workplace culture 
Professional growth and development opportunities 
Comprehensive, paid training and ongoing support 

If you’re curious, ready for a unique challenge, and want to make a real impact, we want to hear from you! 

At oOh!, we celebrate diversity and strive for an inclusive environment. We welcome applications from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and refugees. 

To be considered, applicants must be Australian citizens or permanent residents with full working rights in Australia, and all offers of employment are subject to employer-funded pre-employment checks including police, reference, and work rights verification, with additional checks such as credit, bankruptcy, drug and alcohol screening, or driver’s licence verification required for some roles.

Infrastructure Engineer

We are seeking multiple Infrastructure Engineers to join one of our Federal Government Agencies. These positions are located on-site in Canberra, Melbourne and Brisbane.

Contract Details:

Initial Term:12 months.
Extensions:Two 12-month extension options.
Clearance:Candidates must hold a current NV2 Clearance

Role Overview: You will implement, manage, and retire the physical, virtual, networking, and cloud infrastructure that supports critical digital services.

Key Responsibilities:

Contribute to the investigation, diagnosis, and resolution of network problems and provide advice on preventative strategies.
Design and implement network changes and maintenance routines using technical expertise.
Manage support requests and outstanding problems in accordance with established standards, policies, and procedures.
Build and sustain effective working relationships while actively participating in multi-disciplinary team activities.
Interpret and comply with security policies while contributing to the development of technical standards and guidelines.
Investigate and resolve network issues, taking the initiative to identify and implement alternative courses of action.

Requirements:

Proficiency in network automation and a high level of knowledge regarding protocols, architectures, devices, and topologies.
Proven background in using infrastructure management tools to determine system load and performance, including the creation of automation scripting.
Experience in the analysis of service availability, reliability, and maintainability against agreed performance targets.

How to Apply: If you would like to be considered, please click the "Apply" button to share your CV. One of our consultants will reach out to you to discuss the role further. Please note that only suitable candidates will be contacted.

Infrastructure Engineers

Long term Contract role – Federal Govt. Dept.
QLD, ACT, VIC - Onsite
Australian Citizenship with NV2 Clearance
About the Role:
A high‑profile Federal Government program is seeking multiple experienced Infrastructure Engineers to support implementing, managing and retiring the infrastructure (including physical, virtual, networking and cloud infrastructure) that supports digital services.

Key Responsibilities:

Contribute to the investigation, diagnosis and resolution of network issues, providing expert advice on preventative strategies.
Ensure all support requests are actioned and outstanding problems are managed.
Design and implement network changes and maintenance routines using established technical experience.
Interpret and comply with security policy, contributing to the development of standards and guidelines.
Investigate and resolve network problems, using initiative to identify and implement alternative solutions.
Technical Skills & Experience:

Demonstrated experience with infrastructure management tools to determine load and performance of systems/software. This includes the configuration or creation of automation scripting.
Demonstrated experience in the analysis of service and component availability, reliability, maintainability and serviceability.
Demonstrated experience in the investigation of systems issues and the resolution/mitigation of these issues.
Demonstrated experience in the installation, de-installation of complex systems or system components.
Role Specifics:

Submission deadline: 16 Feb 2026

Duration: 12 months

Location: QLD, ACT, VIC – Onsite

Eligibility: Australian Citizenship with NV2 clearance

For a detailed job brief apply now or contact our Canberra office on 02-6257 8888.

Ready to shape the future of AI at the Administrative Review Tribunal? Come and join us.

We are currently recruiting two APS6 Technical Specialist, AI positions to join the Information Technology team, internally known as the Enterprise Technology Group (ETG) and are seeking applications from experienced professionals to help shape the safe and responsible use of AI. Your work will help balance innovation with transparency and compliance.

These new and exciting full-time ongoing roles can be located in Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Darwin, Hobart, Melbourne, Sydney or Perth.

Remuneration: The annual salary range is APS6 - $94,563 – $106,394 p.a., plus a generous employer superannuation contribution of 15.4%.

Please note - our Enterprise Agreement will deliver a 3.4% pay increase from 12 March 2026.

About the opportunity

The ETG is responsible for the successful implementation and delivery of ICT strategy and operations to achieve the Tribunal’s strategic objectives, ensuring measurable benefits are realised in an effective and efficient manner.

Working under the direction of the AI Services Lead, the Technical Specialist – AI plays a key role in ensuring the secure, ethical and compliant use of artificial intelligence across the Administrative Review Tribunal.

These positions offer the opportunity to work flexibly, including regular work‑from‑home arrangements, within a collaborative and geographically dispersed team.), of approximately 85 staff supporting the Tribunal’s digital, technology and modernisation initiatives.

About you:

You will provide specialist technical advice and support and contribute to the development and implementation of AI governance frameworks, policies, standards and controls that align with legislative, security and privacy requirements. You will also assess and manage AI‑related risks, support assurance activities, and ensure appropriate safeguards are embedded throughout the AI lifecycle.

Working at the intersection of modern technology, policy and risk, you’ll influence how AI is designed and governed in the Tribunal, ensuring solutions are secure, compliant and aligned with public service and Tribunal values.

To excel in this role, you will:

have a thirst for continuous learning of cutting-edge technology and be able to contextually apply this knowledge when considering novel approaches to manage risk and enable business solutions.
be well acquainted with Australian Government cyber security frameworks and across the latest guidelines and practices of AI use in government
be especially adept with Microsoft technologies including Azure AI and Copilot
be able to communicate complex information clearly and succinctly, both orally and in written material

Essential: 

Ability to obtain and maintain a baseline security clearance
The Tribunal requires Australian Citizenship as a condition of engagement.
All employees are required to undertake an Australian Federal Police Check and complete a health declaration.

Desirable:

Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Data Science, AI and/or related disciplines
Vocational certification in modern technologies and agile methodologies eg AWS, Azure, Scrum, ITIL, TOGAF, COBIT, PRINCE2/PM BOK

More information about this position, the scope of the role, duties and required capabilities and experience, is contained within the Position Description, which is linked below and available on our Career Opportunities page.

About the Tribunal:

The Administrative Review Tribunal plays a crucial role in the Australian legal landscape, providing a process for individuals and organisations to seek an independent review of decisions made under a wide range of Commonwealth laws.

We believe in providing our employees with a work environment that is supportive and rewarding. Our culture is one that welcomes all and we embrace flexibility and diversity. We believe our people are our most valuable asset and we work to support the skills, knowledge and capability of our staff.

You can learn more about the Tribunal on our website.

What we offer:   

We believe the little extras can make a big difference in supporting your success and some of our great incentives include:

Flexible working options, including flexi-time and remote working to support you with your commitments outside of work.
competitive salary including generous superannuation employer contribution of 15.4%
salary packaging options
supportive career development opportunities
access to holistic health and wellbeing programs including Fitness Passport which provides discount to 350+ gyms, free annual influenza vaccinations and free eye tests
generous leave allowances including Christmas to New Year office closure with no deduction from your leave balance and options to purchase leave.
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
positive and inclusive culture.

Read our Enterprise Agreement for more information about our terms and conditions of employment.

How to apply:

To be considered, all applications must be submitted online via the Career Opportunities page. Please click on the job title you are applying for, click apply at the top of the page and follow the instructions on the online application.

Please do not apply via SEEK Apply portal.

Please submit a CV (e.g. of no more than 4 pages) and cover letter (of no more than 2 pages) addressing how your experience matches the capabilities and experience of role, referring to the Position Description.

Applications close: Wednesday 18 February 2026 AEDT at 11.45 pm 2026

Should you wish to discuss this position, please contact:

Name:         Semih Ates

Title:             AI Service Lead (Acting)

Tel:               02 9276 5456

Email:           Semih.Ates@art.gov.au

Please contact the Talent team on (02) 9276 5443 or recruitment@art.gov.au should you require assistance with accessing our website or with lodging your application.

Suitable candidates on this merit list/pool may be contacted in relation to identical or similar non-ongoing and ongoing roles in the Tribunal, or the broader APS, within 18 months from the original advertised date in gazettal.

be especially adept with Microsoft technologies including Azure AI and Copilot
be able to communicate complex information clearly and succinctly, both orally and in written material

Essential: 

Ability to obtain and maintain a baseline security clearance
The Tribunal requires Australian Citizenship as a condition of engagement.
All employees are required to undertake an Australian Federal Police Check and complete a health declaration.

Desirable:

Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Data Science, AI and/or related disciplines
Vocational certification in modern technologies and agile methodologies eg AWS, Azure, Scrum, ITIL, TOGAF, COBIT, PRINCE2/PM BOK

More information about this position, the scope of the role, duties and required capabilities and experience, is contained within the Position Description, which is linked below and available on our Career Opportunities page.

About the Tribunal:

The Administrative Review Tribunal plays a crucial role in the Australian legal landscape, providing a process for individuals and organisations to seek an independent review of decisions made under a wide range of Commonwealth laws.

We believe in providing our employees with a work environment that is supportive and rewarding. Our culture is one that welcomes all and we embrace flexibility and diversity. We believe our people are our most valuable asset and we work to support the skills, knowledge and capability of our staff.

You can learn more about the Tribunal on our website.

What we offer:   

We believe the little extras can make a big difference in supporting your success and some of our great incentives include:

Flexible working options, including flexi-time and remote working to support you with your commitments outside of work.
competitive salary including generous superannuation employer contribution of 15.4%
salary packaging options
supportive career development opportunities
access to holistic health and wellbeing programs including Fitness Passport which provides discount to 350+ gyms, free annual influenza vaccinations and free eye tests
generous leave allowances including Christmas to New Year office closure with no deduction from your leave balance and options to purchase leave.
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
positive and inclusive culture.

Read our Enterprise Agreement for more information about our terms and conditions of employment.

How to apply:

To be considered, all applications must be submitted online via the Career Opportunities page. Please click on the job title you are applying for, click apply at the top of the page and follow the instructions on the online application.

Please do not apply via SEEK Apply portal.

Please submit a CV (e.g. of no more than 4 pages) and cover letter (of no more than 2 pages) addressing how your experience matches the capabilities and experience of role, referring to the Position Description.

Applications close: Wednesday 18 February 2026 AEDT at 11.45 pm 2026

Should you wish to discuss this position, please contact:

Name:         Semih Ates

Title:             AI Service Lead (Acting)

Tel:               02 9276 5456

Email:           Semih.Ates@art.gov.au

Please contact the Talent team on (02) 9276 5443 or recruitment@art.gov.au should you require assistance with accessing our website or with lodging your application.

NO AGENCIES PLEASE

We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to responding to every applicant.

Please note a merit list/pool may be created to fill future like vacancies. Suitable candidates on this merit list/pool may be contacted in relation to identical or similar non-ongoing and ongoing roles in the Tribunal, or the broader APS, within 18 months from the original advertised date in gazettal.

The Administrative Review Tribunal is an Equal Opportunities employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion for all employees. We encourage and welcome applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, all genders, LGBTQI+ community and mature age people. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us if invited to interview.

RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the job. For more information visit: https://www.apsc.gov.au/recruitability

Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Video AI Engine
Ad Text:
Company Description


Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point. 

Where and how you can work

Our flagship campus is in Sydney, with a second campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide, and Auckland, NZ. You have flexibility in how and where you work — whether that's from one of our spaces, from home, or a mix of both. This role is remote-friendly within Australia or New Zealand, so you can choose the setup that empowers you and your team to do your best work.

Job Description


About the Group/Team

The Video AI Engine team sits within the Video group in the Design Experience supergroup. We build the infrastructure that connects advanced AI research with delightful product experiences in Canva’s video editor. From video segmentation and effect orchestration to scalable ML serving, we’re enabling users to create cinematic stories, automatically and effortlessly.

About the Role/Specialty

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and large-scale production. You’ll help productionize novel models, optimize inference performance, and work side-by-side with cross-functional teams to deploy delightful, real-time experiences in Canva’s editor. You’ll bring curiosity, rigour, and craft to an area that’s rapidly evolving, and deeply meaningful for our users.

What you’ll do (responsibilities)

• You’ll productionize video-based ML models, enabling scalable, reliable deployment
• You’ll develop high-performance inference pipelines for near real-time use in Canva’s editor
• You’ll experiment with and evaluate model effectiveness for diverse video editing use cases
• You’ll collaborate with AI researchers to translate novel techniques into deployable video tools
• You’ll contribute to scalable ML infrastructure and model serving and experimentational frameworks
• You’ll participate in roadmap discussions, engineering reviews, and planning cycles
• You’ll be hands-on with model evaluation, optimization, and continuous improvements

What we're looking for

• Experience deploying ML models into production, ideally for video, vision, or generative applications
• Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Torch)
• Strong systems knowledge, including working with inference pipelines and performance optimization
• Familiarity with ML lifecycle tooling—experiment tracking, monitoring, deployment
• Collaborative approach and ability to work across product, research, and infrastructure teams
• A user-focused mindset and drive to create magical experiences powered by ML

Additional Information


Don't tick all the boxes? Don't worry about that - nobody does!  

We’d still love to hear from you! At Canva, we know that great engineers come from a variety of backgrounds, and we value passion, curiosity, and a willingness to learn just as much as specific experience. If you're excited about this role but don’t tick every box, we encourage you to apply, you might a great fit in ways you didn’t expect!

What's in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out  lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.
